reviewText: WILD RIDES 4 Movie Pack also includes a bio of Cliff Robertson as a bonus feature. This collection has a car/action theme. (NOTE: This item is in no way related to roller coasters!) SYNOPSES: BAIL OUT-- The "Three Stooges" of bail bondsmen try to keep alive an important witness scheduled to testify at a high profile drug trial. Includes some fine car chase work. KILLING CARS-- The inventor of an electric-powered auto is targeted for death by corrupt oilmen. SHAKER RUN-- Scientist steals a deadly bio-agent to prevent her nation's military from gaining access to it. She enlists the aid of two unwitting accomplices to flee the country. STUNTS-- Stuntmen on a movie set are mysteriously dying. The brother of one of the dead men investigates these "accidents" when he's not participating in stunt scenes. DANGEROUS CURVES 4 Movie Pack (also from BCI / Eclipse) contains lots of truckin' adventures. BRENTWOOD's 4-fers are nicely priced movie bundles. Video and sound quality of these digitally unrestored public domain films is generally fine. Discs are dual-side recorded. . Parenthetical numbers preceding titles are 1 to 10 imdb viewer poll ratings. (4.4) Bail Out ("W.B., Blue and the Bean") (1989) - David Hasselhoff/Linda Blair/John Vernon (4.6) Killing Cars (W Germany-1986) - Jrgen Prochnow/Senta Berger/William Conrad (4.9) Shaker Run (New Zealand-1985) - Cliff Robertson/Leif Garrett/Lisa Harrow/Shane Briant (5.1) Stunts (1977) - Robert Forster/Fiona Lewis/Ray Sharkey/Joanna Cassidy/Bruce Glover

Editorial Review - "Ride the Desperado and feel the white-knuckled terror generated by its terrifying 280-foot drop." It's hard for me to think much of a DVD that adds 60 extra feet to the drop of a ride. The better roller coaster documentaries give the real facts and not sloppy assumptions.

It was a good documentary and the DVD does have seperate tracks with just the rides from each roller coaster that would have been better if it was all done from one spot or allowed the angle button to see the different  angles instead of switching from the car to the ground at random. The menus  stink and can only be accessed from the number pad.  It is in DD albeit  poorly.  It is a good documentary done in true Discover Channel fashion so  for that alone if you *realy* like roller coasters it is a good DVD. Dont  buy it expecting to "experience" riding a roller coaster - save  that for super speedway!

This is a must see for a roller coaster lover. Awesome in board camera shots make this a great video. Gives recognition to some quiet coasters that are definantly thrilling. Also shows some of the best in the buisness,  including:Raptor,Texas Giant,Magnum, Desperado and many more. For more  thrills the box set is incredible.
